org.smartfrog.tools.ant
Class SmartFrogTask

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.smartfrog.tools.ant.TaskBase
              org.smartfrog.tools.ant.SmartFrogTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, SysPropertyAdder
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeployingTaskBase, PingTask, StopApplication, StopDaemon
public abstract class SmartFrogTask
extends TaskBase
implements SysPropertyAdder

Class to let ant task derivatives run smartfrog. How it invokes smartfrog is an implementation detail; it may be calling the Java task, it may be calling smartfrog direct. What is not a detail is that the combined classpath of ant+ any classpath parameters must include all the relevant smartfrog JAR files.

Smartfrog can be configured via system properties, an ini file, or the explicit properties of this task. All the attributes of this task that configure SmartFrog (port, liveness, spawning, stack trace) are undefined; whatever defaults are built into SmartFrog apply, not any hard coded in the task. This also permits one to override smartfrog by setting system properties inline, or in a property set.

By default, all tasks are given a timeout of ten minutes; and propagate any failure to execute to the build file. These can be adjusted via the setTimeout(long) and setFailOnError(boolean) calls respectively. Note that when spawning, timeout and failonerror attributes are ignored (a verbose level message warns of this). passing them on to the java task would result in a failure.

execSmartFrog

protected boolean execSmartFrog(java.lang.String failureText,
                                java.lang.String errorText)
run smartfrog and throw an exception if something went awry. failure texts are for when smartfrog ran and failed; errorTexts when smartfrog wouldnt run.

Parameters:
failureText - text when return value==-1
errorText - text when return value!=0 && !=1-
Returns:
the return code from executing java
Throws:
org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if the return value was an error and failonerror!=false

execSmartFrog

protected boolean execSmartFrog(java.lang.String failureText)
simpler entry point with a set message on errors

Parameters:
failureText - text when smartfrog returns '1'
Returns:
the result of executing smartfrog
Throws:
org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - on trouble, especially when failonerror=true
